nitf_DownSampler Struct Reference

The downsampler base class. More...

#include <DownSampler.h>

Detailed Description

The downsampler base class.

The downsampler base class (like the nitf_BandSource base class) has two components: fields or members (stored in the user data parameter), and a known interface of functions. This is, more or less, the most simplified representation of a 'class.'

Parameters:
face The functional interface
rowSkip The number of rows in the down-sample window
colSkip The number of columns in the down-sample window
multiBand The down-sampler method is muli-band
minBands Minimum number of bands in multi-band method
maxBands Maxmum number of bands in multi-band method
types Mask of type/pixel size flags
data The derived class instance data
The multiBand, minBands, and maxBands fields support multi-band methods. The min and max fields specify required band counts. minBands is always at least one. For multi-band method that do not have an upper limit on badn count, maxBands is set to zero.

The types field is a mask that specifies the supported pixel types and sizes. Each bit represents one type/size pair (i.e. one byte INT). For the binary pixel type, the byte count is one and for the 12-bit type it is two
